poem:
The Market's Pulse

Red ink drips  
on cold ledgers,  
a dance of numbers  
to unpredictable rhythms—  
tariff whispers,  
a scatter of promises.  

In frantic halls,  
nervous fingers tap  
as green turns  
to yellow,  
to red again.  

A slow unraveling,  
a distant thunder  
of Wall Street's heart.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The President appears to be taking a scatter-gun approach in terms of targets, while teasing the markets with last minute reprieves, delays or softening in scope. All-in-all, it’s proving difficult to price". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
